intro: Erodium absinthoides subsp. latifolium, commonly known as broadleaf bedstraw, is a flowering plant in the family Geraniaceae. It is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces clusters of pink to purple flowers with five petals, typical of the Geraniaceae family. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in open areas such as roadsides and fields. Broadleaf bedstraw is an annual herb that blooms from spring to early summer.
